newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Akzo's Organon wins Roche appeal case.
newsitem.headline: Akzo's Organon wins Roche appeal case.

text.p: Chemicals to pharmaceuticals company Akzo Nobel said on Thursday its Organon Teknika unit had won an appeal court case against Hoffmann-Laroche over a patent battle regarding HIV tests.
"The new, innovative NASBA-tests for HIV (the AIDS-virus) by Organon Teknika do not violate patents owned by Hoffmann-Laroche," Akzo said in a statement.
A civil court in The Hague had issued the verdict on Thursday, confirming an earlier summary judgement.
The HIV NASBA tests are used to detect infection with the HIV virus at a very early stage.
In this process Organon Teknika's NASBA amplification technology multiplies small amounts of genetic material from the AIDS-virus to detectable quantities.
In other countries litigation between Teknika and Roche on the NASBA kits is still pending.
